edu.biu.scapi.primitives.dlog
Interface ECElement

All Superinterfaces:
GroupElement
All Known Subinterfaces:
ECF2mPoint, ECFpPoint
All Known Implementing Classes:
ECF2mPointBc, ECF2mPointMiracl, ECF2mPointOpenSSL, ECFpPointBc, ECFpPointMiracl, ECFpPointOpenSSL, ECPointBc
public interface ECElement
extends GroupElement

Marker interface. Every class that implements it, is signed as an elliptic curve point

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

Method Summary
 java.math.BigInteger getX()
          This function returns the x coordinate of the (x,y) point which is an element of a given elliptic curve.
 java.math.BigInteger getY()
          This function returns the y coordinate of the (x,y) point which is an element of a given elliptic curve.
 boolean isInfinity()
          Elliptic curve has a unique point called infinity.
 
Methods inherited from interface edu.biu.scapi.primitives.dlog.GroupElement
generateSendableData, isIdentity
 

Method Detail

getX

java.math.BigInteger getX()
This function returns the x coordinate of the (x,y) point which is an element of a given elliptic curve. In case of infinity point, returns null.

Returns:
x coordinate of (x,y) point

getY

java.math.BigInteger getY()
This function returns the y coordinate of the (x,y) point which is an element of a given elliptic curve. In case of infinity point, returns null.

Returns:
y coordinate of (x,y) point

isInfinity

boolean isInfinity()
Elliptic curve has a unique point called infinity. In order to know if this object is an infinity point, this function should be called.

Returns:
true if this point is the infinity, false, otherwise.
